00037 //............................................................................
00038 // NOTE: the QK scheduler is entered and exited with interrupts LOCKED
00039 #ifndef QF_INT_KEY_TYPE
00040 void QK_scheduleExt_(void) {
00041 #else
00042 void QK_scheduleExt_(QF_INT_KEY_TYPE intLockKey_) {
00043 #endif
00044                          // the QK scheduler must be called at task level only
00045     Q_REQUIRE(QK_intNest_ == (uint8_t)0);
00046 
00047            // determine the priority of the highest-priority task ready to run
00048     uint8_t p = QK_readySet_.findMax();
00049 
00050 #ifdef QK_NO_MUTEX
00051     if (p > QK_currPrio_) {                        // do we have a preemption?
00052 #else                                   // QK priority-ceiling mutexes allowed
00053     if ((p > QK_currPrio_) && (p > QK_ceilingPrio_)) {
00054 #endif
00055         uint8_t pin = QK_currPrio_;               // save the initial priority
00056         QActive *a;
00057 #ifdef QK_TLS                                    // thread-local storage used?
00058         uint8_t pprev = pin;
00059 #endif
00060 #ifdef QK_EXT_SAVE                            // extended context-switch used?
00061         if (pin != (uint8_t)0) {      // no extended context for the idle loop
00062             a = QF::active_[pin];           // the pointer to the preempted AO
00063             QK_EXT_SAVE(a);                       // save the extended context
00064         }
00065 #endif
00066         do {
00067             QEvent const *e;
00068             a = QF::active_[p];                // obtain the pointer to the AO
00069             QK_currPrio_ = p;        // this becomes the current task priority
00070 
00071 #ifdef QK_TLS                                    // thread-local storage used?
00072             if (p != pprev) {                      // are we changing threads?
00073                 QK_TLS(a);                  // switch new thread-local storage
00074                 pprev = p;
00075             }
00076 #endif
00077             QS_BEGIN_NOLOCK_(QS_QK_SCHEDULE, QS::aoObj_, a)
00078                 QS_TIME_();                                       // timestamp
00079                 QS_U8_(p);                // the priority of the active object
00080                 QS_U8_(pin);                         // the preempted priority
00081             QS_END_NOLOCK_()
00082 
00083             QK_INT_UNLOCK_();                         // unlock the interrupts
00084 
00085             e = a->get_();        // get the next event for this active object
00086             a->dispatch(e);                 // dispatch e to the active object
00087             QF::gc(e);              // garbage collect the event, if necessary
00088 
00089             QK_INT_LOCK_();
00090                              // determine the highest-priority AO ready to run
00091             p = QK_readySet_.findMax();
00092 
00093 #ifdef QK_NO_MUTEX
00094         } while (p > pin);         // is the new priority higher than initial?
00095 #else                                   // QK priority-ceiling mutexes allowed
00096         } while ((p > pin) && (p > QK_ceilingPrio_));
00097 #endif
00098         QK_currPrio_ = pin;                    // restore the initial priority
00099 
00100 #if defined(QK_TLS) || defined(QK_EXT_RESTORE)
00101         if (pin != (uint8_t)0) {      // no extended context for the idle loop
00102             a = QF::active_[pin];           // the pointer to the preempted AO
00103     #ifdef QK_TLS                                // thread-local storage used?
00104             QK_TLS(a);                             // restore the original TLS
00105     #endif
00106     #ifdef QK_EXT_RESTORE                     // extended context-switch used?
00107             QK_EXT_RESTORE(a);                 // restore the extended context
00108     #endif
00109         }
00110 #endif
00111     }
00112 }
